name: cnncvs

body.origin:
|- wcel(c0, cin(cnvc, ccvs))
-| wcel(c0, cnvc)
-| wcel(c0, ccvs)
body.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈(NrmVec ⋂ CVec)
⊣ c0 ∈ NrmVec
⊣ c0 ∈ CVec

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(c0, cin(cnvc, ccvs))
-| wcel(c0, cnvc)
-| wcel(c0, ccvs)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈(NrmVec ⋂ CVec)
⊣ c0 ∈ NrmVec
⊣ c0 ∈ CVec

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(c0, cin(cnvc, ccvs))
-| wcel(c0, ccvs)
-| wceq(c0, cfv(crglmod, ccnfld))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈(NrmVec ⋂ CVec)
⊣ c0 ∈ CVec
⊣ c0 =(ringLMod ` CCfld)

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(c0, cin(cnvc, ccvs))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(crglmod, ccnfld))

comment: The module of complex numbers (as a module over itself) is a normed subcomplex vector space. The vector operation is ` + ` , the scalar product is ` x. ` , and the norm is ` abs ` (see ~ cnnm ) . (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 3-Dec-2006.) (Revised by AV, 9-Oct-2021.)
